title: 112_s3077
content: The Act is titled the "Pro Football Hall of Fame Commemorative Coin Act" and includes findings. The Pro Football Hall of Fame was established to honor individuals who have made significant contributions to professional football, preserve its history, educate the public, and promote the sport's positive values. It opened on September 7, 1963, inducting a charter class of 17 players, coaches, and contributors. Membership in the Hall of Fame is represented by a bronze bust, a gold jacket, and a ring, with 273 members elected as of 2012. The Pro Football Hall of Fame, established in 1963, has grown to a 118,000-square-foot facility with expansions and renovations over the years. It houses the world's largest collection on professional football, including over 20,000 artifacts and 20 million pages of documents. The Hall reaches a worldwide audience of nearly 15 million people annually through various channels. The Pro Football Hall of Fame reaches a global audience of nearly 15 million people annually through its website, social media, events, and educational programs. SEC. 3. COIN SPECIFICATIONS. The Secretary of the Treasury is authorized to mint and issue $5 gold coins, $1 silver coins, and half-dollar clad coins with specific weights, diameters, and compositions. These coins will be legal tender according to the United States Code. All coins minted under this Act shall be considered numismatic items as per section 5134 of title 31, United States Code. Design of coins minted under this Act shall symbolize professional football, with specific inscriptions and values. The design will be chosen by the Secretary in consultation with the Commission of Fine Arts and the Pro Football Hall of Fame, and reviewed by the Citizens Coinage Advisory Committee. SEC. 5. ISSUANCE OF COINS. Coins minted under this Act shall be issued in uncirculated and proof qualities at a single designated mint facility for a 1-year period starting on January 1, 2016. SEC. 6. SALE OF COINS. The coins will be sold by the Secretary at a price including face value, surcharge, and cost of designing. Bulk sales will be offered at a discount, and prepaid orders will receive a reasonable discount. All sales of coins issued under this Act will include surcharges of $35 per $5 coin, $10 per $1 coin, and $5 per half-dollar coin. The surcharges will be promptly paid to the Pro Football Hall of Fame for construction and renovation. The Hall of Fame will be audited for the amounts received. No surcharge will be included if it exceeds the annual commemorative coin program limit. The Secretary of the Treasury may issue guidance for the coin program issuance limitation under section 5112(m)(1) of title 31, United States Code.
